question.text:
Given below are two statements, one is labelled as assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.
assertion A : CoClNH352+ absorbs at lower wavelength of light with respect to CoNH35H2O3+
Reason R: It is because the wavelenght of light absorbed depends on the oxidation state of the metal ion.
In the light of the above statements,choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math> is false but <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> is true
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math> is true but <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> is false

Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> are true and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> is the correct explaination of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math>

Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> are true and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">R</mi></math> is NOT the correct explaination of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="bold">A</mi></math>

solution.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mi>CoCl</mi><msub><mfenced><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>absorbs with higher wavelength of light with respect to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced open="[" close="]"><mrow><mi>Co</mi><msub><mfenced><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> because <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Cl</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> is weaker ligand than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>. The crystal field stabilisation is higher for <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced open="[" close="]"><mrow><mi>Co</mi><msub><mfenced><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>, hence we can say that wavelength of light absorbed depends upon the oxidation state of the metal ion.

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
